intro: Sebastiania crenulata, commonly known as the waxleaf sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green, waxy leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. It produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Sebastiania crenulata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in indoor conditions.
